[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Constant: MaxLengthForTitle] [Boundary Condition] What happens when a title is exactly 255 characters? Are there off-by-one errors in the validation that could allow 256 characters, or reject valid 255-character titles? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Constant: MaxLengthForDescription] [Boundary Condition] Could a proposal with description length exactly 10200 cause integer overflow or buffer issues in downstream systems that allocate fixed buffers based on this constant? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Missing Constants] [Input Validation] Are there minimum length requirements? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Missing Constants] [DOS] Without minimum length requirements, could an attacker create thousands of minimal-size proposals to bloat the proposal database while consuming minimal transaction fees? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Constant: MaxLengthForProposalDescriptionUrl] [URL Validation] The URL length limit is checked before URI validation - could an attacker craft a 255-character string that passes length validation but fails URI validation, wasting gas without creating a valid proposal? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Constant: MaxLengthForProposalDescriptionUrl] [URL Validation] Could the 255-character limit prevent the use of legitimate long URLs with extensive query parameters, forcing proposers to use URL shorteners that could later be hijacked or expire? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [Constant: MaxLengthForDescription] [Resource Cost] Is there dynamic pricing for proposal creation based on description length? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/AssociationConstants.cs] [All Constants] [Migration] Is there a mechanism to validate that proposed constant changes are backward-compatible?
